p: In the initial stages of HIV outbreak in central Asian region, most people infected with HIV acquired a homogenic variant of subtype A, known as A FSU (A6). This was thought to be a large-scale founder effect, resulting from transmigration within FSU countries [ 20]. The first HIV epidemic in FSU was recorded in the mid-1990s in Ukraine. A year later, outbreaks were detected in the European part of Russia, thereafter reaching other parts of Russia, Central Asia, and Eastern Europe.
